job_title: Peer Support Specialist in Dubuque, IA
pros: Hillcrest is a great place to work and learn. They offer so much training and education to their employees. Staff are amazing and helpful.
cons: The pay could be better. I believe that has gone up since I left. I would still be there if I hadn't had to stop working due to health issues.

job_title: Lmhc/Mental Health Therapist in Dubuque, IA
pros: Can practice with temp LMHC and get supervised experience for full licensure
cons: Micromanagement, poor pay, contract required for supervision, non-compete clause after employment is terminated.

pros: My position allows flexible work hours, I get to choose any time I get to work so it's nice to be able to move around things for Dr appointments without using PTO.
cons: The company seems to move backwards. Since I started they've slimmed PTO actual rates from .75 to .35 so it takes a very long time before you actually accrue pto now. Most areas within Hillcrest have unhelpful supervision and coworkers who are not properly trained so they call clients things like "lazy" and supervisors are too afraid of more staff leaving so they do nothing about issues.

pros: There is always clients so you will be busy!
cons: Frustrations with being overworked and underpaid

pros: It is flexible. Really encourages on the job learning/training as well as supplemental education.

job_title: Licensed Mental Health Counselor in Dubuque, IA
pros: Fast paced, busy, good mentoring
cons: Very easy to burn out, graded on productivity, no breaks,

pros:
Great working atmosphere
Management truly care about their employees 
Great working for an agency that stands for such great values and it makes going to work really worth something 
There are many things to get involved in throughout the agency such as a wellness program and the diversity committee. 
Great benefits
cons:
Work can be stressful at times which can cause burnout 
Agency in contently growing which causes fluctuation in management team

pros: Great opportunities for career advancement if you are looking to work in the field of social services, education or non-profits. Client-focused, passionate staff. Flexible work schedules.
cons: Work-life balance more difficult to obtain for mid and upper-management. Lack of parking, and technology lags behind the times which seems to be common for non-profits.

pros: Supportive Colleagues; obtained clinical licensure; supportive supervisor
cons: Management cared more about revenue than client rights or healthy therapeutic treatments; salaries were much too low for the type of services being provided; unsupportive environment at times; lack of training and emphasis on competence.

pros: Hillcrest is a great place to work. I enjoy all the dedicated, yet fun employees I work with. Everyone truly cares about their work and ultimately helping our clients live full and productive lives. They offer a great work/life balance for employees.
cons: Nothing that I can think of.

pros: Helping clients and community members who are in need of services.
cons:
We've had a new VP/C.O.O. for about a year (after only being with the organization for about 2 years), and several programs have closed since he stepped into that position. When your job title is chief OPERATING officer, and programs are doing the exact OPPOSITE of OPERATING...hmmm...maybe it's time for you to leave. 
Complete lack of communication between staff and upper management. .

pros: some dedicated employees that are hard working and experienced
cons: low pay, micro-management, over extending itself too fast rather than improving process or system, seems to desire quantity over quality
